title: What are some good heavy metal bands with female singers? - Quora

response.answer_text: Warlock was a heavy metal band back in the 80s. After the band broke up, their lead singer, Doro Pesch would start her solo career, playing music in the same style.   Unleash the Archers is a heavy/power metal band. And damn, their vocalist can hit those highs!   Arch Enemy is a melodic death metal band. Their first female vocalist, Angela Gossow, joined the band in 2000. Alissa White-Gluz has been vocalist since 2014.   Battle Beast is a power/heavy metal band:  Darkened Nocturn Slaughtercult is a band that plays black metal of the old-school style, fast, harsh, raw, & hard-hitting. As far as kvlt goes, they’re pretty damn trve.  Babymetal is a band that mixes J-pop & metal. A lot of people hate them, but personally, I think they’re great.  Kalevala is a folk metal band from Russia. I have no idea what she’s singing about, but they sound good.  I really like In This Moment, but they’re more alternative/mallcore than “true” metal:  Pretty much every symphonic or gothic metal band is female-fronted or uses ‘beauty & the beast’ vocals (clean female vocals & harsh male vocals), so I’ll just leave a massive dump of bands here. They get shit on by some metalheads because they’re so melodic, but I personally like them. Nemo by Nightwish:  Victims of Contingency by Epica:  Shot in the Dark by Within Temptation:  Emerald Island by Leaves’ Eyes:  Carmilla by Theatres des Vampires  Siren by Theatre of Tragedy (this band is split-up now)  Year of the Rat by Tristania:  Trip the Darkness by Lacuna Coil:  Bloodflower by Draconian:  Dark Star by Tarja:  Dark Lantern by Mandragora Scream:  Nightfall by Xandria:  Here’s My Hell by ReVamp (this band is split up now)  My Mind’s Eye by Sirenia:  Beautifully Decayed by As Angels Bleed:  Son of the Sun by Therion:  Stardust by Delain:

I’ll answer this just about classic metal bands from the 1970s and 1980s, since that’s the era I know and listen to. Girlschool. One of the major all-female bands in metal. Did some very cool crossovers with Motorhead back in the early days. Still out there creating new albums and touring from time to time. Best known perhaps for this song, which got into the Metal Killers Kollection vol. 1  Rock Goddess. Another great British acid all-female band from the same era. They were a bit younger than Girlschool, and never became quite as big and well-connected, but they have some great stuff. A lot of sound coming out of that trio. They too are still producing new material and touring.  Acid: a less well known Belgian metal band, fronted by Kate De Lombaert. Heavy stuff, spread out over three good albums. If you haven’t heard them, you definitely want to listen to their stuff  Bitch: an American band, fronted by Betsy “Bitch” Weiss, who had a S&M motif going throughout their three main albums and touring. Had a lot of turnover among the male bandmembers. Recently reformed.  Warlock. German band fronted by Doro Pesch, who would then go off on a solo career, and do some collaborative work with Udo Dirkschneider. Good stuff there.  Plasmatics. Fronted by Wendy O’ Williams, who then went solo herself. If you like it really raunchy and gritty, she’s the one for you. Some might argue it’s more punk than metal.
